intro: Stemmacantha australis, commonly known as the Australian stemmacantha, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its erect, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to the dry conditions of its native habitat. It is often found in heathlands and dry forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
